labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed for managing and interacting with DevRev issues and tickets. It provides tools for searching, retrieving, creating, and updating DevRev objects, which suggests its primary use case revolves around issue ticket management. This functionality is most closely aligned with API integration and database operations, as it allows seamless access and manipulation of DevRev data through standardized protocols.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is selected as "API Integration" because the server acts as a bridge between an LLM-powered workflow and the DevRev system, facilitating data access and manipulation. The secondary label "Database Operations" is chosen because the server interacts with issues and tickets, which are akin to database records. No custom label is needed as the existing predefined categories sufficiently describe the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: DevRev MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @devrev/mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable seamless search and management of DevRev issues and tickets through a standardized protocol. Perform operations like searching, retrieving, creating, and updating DevRev objects efficiently. Integrate DevRev data access directly into your LLM-powered workflows.

tools.name: search
tools.description: Deploy Server DevRev MCP Server Claim Server @devrev/mcp-server Try in Playground

tools.name: get_object
tools.description: Get all information about a DevRev issue and ticket using its ID

tools.description: Create a new isssue or ticket in DevRev

tools.name: update_object
tools.description: Update an existing issue or ticket in DevRev

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@devrev/mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
